metadata.title: CVE-2017-17505 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference in the function H5O_pline_decode in the H5Opline.c file in libhdf5.a. For example, h5dump would crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file. It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain hdf5 files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-4
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-mpich-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-cpp-103-1 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-fortran-102 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-cpp-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
libhdf5-openmpi-hl-fortran-100 - 1.10.4+repack-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-4').
